Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 1

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR, 7 MILLS PROPERTY TAX TO BE USED FOR CONSTRUCTING, IMPROVING, EQUIPPING, OPERATING, MAINTAINING AND SUPPORTING THE MADISON PARISH COURTHOUSE AND JAIL.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a special tax of seven (7) mills on all property subject to taxation within the Parish for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2007 and ending with the year 2016, to be used for constructing, improving, equipping, operating, maintaining and supporting the Madison Parish Courthouse and Jail?

Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 2

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR, 3 MILLS PROPERTY TAX FOR ACQUIRING, CONSTRUCTING, IMPROVING, MAINTAINING AND/OR OPERATING AN ENHANCED 911 TELEPHONE SYSTEM (INCLUDING THE PAYMENT OF NECESSARY DISPATCH PERSONNEL) IN MADISON PARISH.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), be authorized to levy	a special tax of three (3) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2007 and ending with the year 2016, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating an enhanced 911 telephone system (including the payment of necessary dispatch personnel), in the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sales Tax District No. 1 -- 2% S&U - PJ - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
SALES TAX DISTRICT NO. 1 PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  2%, 10 YEAR SALES AND USE TAX DEDICATED FOR CONSTRUCTING, IMPROVING, MAINTAINING AND RESURFACING PUBLIC ROADS IN SALES TAX DISTRICT NO. 1, INCLUDING PROVIDING INCIDENTAL DRAINAGE, AND ACQUIRING, OPERATING AND MAINTAINING EQUIPMENT FOR SAID PURPOSES, WITH THE PROCEEDS OF THE TAX TO BE SUBJECT TO BEING FUNDED INTO BONDS FOR SAID CAPITAL PURPOSES.
Race.FullText: Shall Sales Tax District No. 1 of the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "District"), under the provisions of the Constitution and statutes of the State of Louisiana, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of two percent (2%) (the "Tax") for a period of ten (10) years from the date of the first levy of the Tax upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the District, as defined by law, with the proceeds of the Tax to be dedicated and used for the purposes of constructing, improving, maintaining and resurfacing public roads in the District, including providing incidental drainage, and acquiring, operating and maintaining equipment for said purposes, and further, shall the District be authorized to fund the proceeds of the Tax into bonds to be issued for said capital purposes to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana, including Sub-Part F, Part III, Chapter 4, Title 39 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended?

Race.SpecificTitle: Afton Fire Prot. Dist. -- $125.00 Service Charge - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
AFTON FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT PROPOSITION
(SERVICE CHARGE CONTINUATION)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR AFTON FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT OF THE PARISH OF MADISON, STATE OF LOUISIANA, TO CONTINUE TO COLLECT A $125 ANNUAL SERVICE CHARGE FOR A PERIOD OF 10 YEARS FOR THE PURPOSE OF PAYING THE COSTS OF FIRE PROTECTION SERVICES IN AND FOR SAID DISTRICT, INCLUDING THE COST OF ACQUIRING, OPERATING AND MAINTAINING EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES NECESSARY FOR SUCH FIRE PROTECTION SERVICES.
Race.FullText: Shall Afton Fire Protection District of the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual service charge of One Hundred Twenty-Five Dollars ($125.00) from persons owning each residential or commercial structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the District, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2006 and ending with the year 2015, for the purpose of paying the costs of fire protection services in and for the District, including  the cost of acquiring, operating and maintaining equipment and facilities necessary for such fire protection services, and, for purposes of assessing and collecting said service charge, owners shall be assessed a service charge for each such structure which they own, and each residential or commercial unit and each housing unit within a multiple dwelling structure shall be considered a separate structure, and a mobile home, as defined in R.S. 9:1149.2(3), shall be considered a structure, provided that persons owning mobile homes shall be assessed eighty percent (80%) of the service charge, all as provided in Section 1502.4 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, amended?
